scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
EuroVoc is not included in any national catalogue of recommended specifications whose Member State NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
EuroVoc is used for the EU Open Data Portal, the site where EU Institutions publish their datasets for their reuse. In there, it is also used the classification of EuroVoc in order to improve the shareability, researchability and interoperability when processing the data. It helps to link data under knowledge domains.  

EuroVoc in EU Open Data Portal:  
https://data.europa.eu/euodp/es/data/dataset/building-stock-observatory

EuroVoc reference:
https://eur-lex.europa.eu/browse/eurovoc.html?locale=en

Tim Berners-Lee 5-star schema for Open Data:   
https://5stardata.info/en/

statement:
EuroVoc was developed for the first time in 1982. It has been constantly evolving to adapt user's needs. Moreover, there are several releases since it was developed that justify its maturity and its use in the developement products and services. 


EuroVoc Releases: 
https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/dataset/-/resource?uri=http://publications.europa.eu/resource/dataset/eurovoc

criterion_description: The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
EuroVoc was developed for the first time in 1982 and has de full support from the European Union, since it was developed to support and help European and National institutions on their functions. The taxonomy categorises knowledge domains close to the European Institution. Therefore, it can be considered with market acceptance at eGovernment level for the development of products and services.

EuroVoc over the time: 
https://op.europa.eu/es/web/eu-vocabularies/th-dataset/-/resource/dataset/eurovoc?target=About#Time

Eurovoc:

criterion_description: The specification is reusable beyond the domain for which it was originally developed.
statement:
Even though EuroVoc is mainly focused on eGovernment since it was developed to support the data processing and classification within European Institutions, it covers different domains and subdomains that go beyond eGovernment such as energy or transports. Therefore, it can be considered as reusable amongst other business domains.

EuroVoc webpage:
https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/dataset/-/resource?uri=http://publications.europa.eu/resource/dataset/eurovoc

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement:
There are different documentation and information that takes into account EuroVoc as part of the narrative and includes it as valuable. An article shows the usefulness of EuroVoc since it is included as the core of an application for the categorisation of documents (see link below). Also, an example of a use case for the Italian Chamber of Deputies. In here, the use case was presented in a EuroVoc conference to show the result and the effectiveness of using EuroVoc as the basis for the semi-automatic classification of documents.

JRC EuroVoc Indexer JEX - A freely available multi-label categorisation tool
https://www.researchgate.net/publication/256846257_JRC_EuroVoc_Indexer_JEX_-_A_freely_available_multi-label_categorisation_tool

Eurovoc and parliamentary documents: A semi-automatic classification experience at the Italian Chamber of Deputies:
https://expertsystem.com/expert-systems-cogito-semantic-platform-to-be-featured-at-eurovoc-conference/

statement:
At the time of elaborating this assessment, this specification is not included in any EIRA ABB in the current European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). Although, this Core Vocabulary is included in a supranational catalogue of standards. 

EIRA Library of Interoperability Specifications (ELIS):
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/release/v100

statement: After searching for a certification or conformity test to validate EuroVoc no tool has been found that assess the conformity of the specification.

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been selected for its use in an EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
EuroVoc is used for data processing acrosss Europe by the European Insitutions and also the National ones. Moreover, there is the possibility to search European Laws amongst other documents using its classification. It can be done through a EurLex, the European Gateway for regulation. 

Additionally, it is used in the EU Open Data Portal as a method for knowledge classification. In the EU Open Data Portal, datasets are related and linked to EuroVoc domains that improve the searchability and reuse of information.

EU Open Data Portal example:
https://data.europa.eu/euodp/es/data/dataset/building-stock-observatory 

Search by EuroVoc: 
https://eur-lex.europa.eu/browse/eurovoc.html?params=12,1216#arrow_1216

Publication Office of the European Union:
https://op.europa.eu/en/home

criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
After checking the different standard catalogues at supra-national level, the Publication Office of the European Union has listed it within EurVocabularies with all the specifications and resources produced and used by European Institutions. 

EU Vocabularies: 
https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies

Joinup post linked to the EuroVoc reosurces: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/eu-semantic-interoperability-catalogue/news/eurovoc-freely-available

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement:
EuroVoc is a public asset that fosters the reusability of information by helping data processing in a standardised way. Therefore, it lays down the Commission Decision of 12 December 2011 on the reuse of Commission documents.

Commission Decision on the Reuse of Commission Documents: 
https://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=OJ:L:2011:330:0039:0042:EN:PDF

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
After checking the assessments performed by CAMSS and the list of specifications identified by the MSP Multi-stakeholder-platform, no assessment verifying the compliance of the specification with the European standardisation regulation has been found. 

However, since is a specification developed by a European Institution it can be assumed that the asset has been developed and maintain in compliance with European Regulations.

EuroVoc webpage: 
https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/dataset/-/resource?uri=http://publications.europa.eu/resource/dataset/eurovoc

EU Vocabularies: 
https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
statement: The purpose of EuroVoc is not related to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement: The purpose of EuroVoc  is not related to the modelling of organisational interoperability aspects.Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
The specification does not define a cross-sector reusable data model. EuroVoc is a taxonomy created for helping the data processing across EU Administrations. Its use can be extended to external users and improves the searchability of information, but it is not a data model.

EuroVoc webpage:
https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/dataset/-/resource?uri=http://publications.europa.eu/resource/dataset/eurovoc

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
EuroVoc is used for the EU Open Data Portal, the site where EU Institutions publish their datasets for their reuse. In there, it is also used the classification of EuroVoc in order to improve the shareability, researchability and interoperability when processing the data. It helps to link data under knowledge domains. 
 
EuroVoc webpage:
https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/dataset/-/resource?uri=http://publications.europa.eu/resource/dataset/eurovoc

5-star linked open data:
https://www.w3.org/DesignIssues/LinkedData.html
